q.quote: The real tragedy of the poor is the poverty of their aspirations.
q.author: Adam Smith

q.quote: My general plan is good, though in the detail there may be faults.
q.author: Adam Weishaupt

q.quote: Crying is really bad for your vocal cords
q.author: Adele

q.quote: Ignorance is stubborn and prejudice is hard.
q.author: Adlai E. Stevenson

q.quote: God always strives together with those who strive
q.author: Aeschylus

q.quote: Gratitude is the sign of noble souls
q.author: Aesop

q.quote: Any woman can fool a man if she wants to and if he's in love with her.
q.author: Agatha Christie

q.quote: Egypt has great potential because of the latent power of its human capital.
q.author: Ahmed Zewail

q.quote: If my heart has nothing to do with people's pain and sorrow, what is 'art' for?
q.author: Ai Weiwei

q.quote: Bravery is the engine of change
q.author: Aisha Tyler

q.quote: It's easier to put on slippers than to carpet the whole world.
q.author: Al Franken

q.quote: A zebra does not change its spots.
q.author: Al Gore

q.quote: There has been a lot of self-doubt and unwelcome events in my life
q.author: Al Pacino

q.quote: We try to eat at home four or five days a week.
q.author: Al Roker

q.quote: The dream was not to put one black family in the White House, the dream was to make everything equal in everybody's house
q.author: Al Sharpton
